sentence.text: Funding is the term applied when the Bank of England attempts to lengthen the maturity of outstanding government debt .
If you buy a 500 W oven , you 'll need to lengthen the cooking time by about 30 per cent .
He had walked away from Sophie and now she lengthened her stride to catch him up .
Plans to lengthen military service from 15 to 18 months will also be scrapped if the talks succeed .
The animal responded at once , quickly lengthening its stride into a gallop .
On the contrary , such an educational approach is likely to lengthen interviews .
He has lengthened the putter , to stand more upright , and quickened his routine on the green .
Since then the USSR has not substantially lengthened their runways .
These can go a very long way to mollifying those individuals whose journeys are lengthened by traffic-affecting measures .
In order to fit everything in , the school day may be lengthened .
Only during the transitional period when unemployment is rising will the chain be lengthened somewhat .
Because the muscles are being lengthened , you may experience pain in them .
Some first degrees should also be lengthened to four years .
Romania 's entry into the war against Austria at the end of August served only to lengthen Russia 's frontier , laying her open to further attack when Romania collapsed in December 1916 .
Again , in running , jumping or leaping , lengthen the spine upwards to prevent wear and tear on discus and joints .
He lengthened rather than quickened his pace -- difficult to detect from behind -- stepped into the alley and sprinted as hard as he could .
